Package org.forgerock.openam.radius.server.spi.handlers

Class AcceptAllHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.openam.radius.server.spi.handlers.AcceptAllHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AccessRequestHandler
    public class AcceptAllHandler
extends Object
implements AccessRequestHandler
    Simple handler that sends an AccessAccept for all incoming Radius access requests. This handler can be used to test the connection from the Radius client to OpenAM without engaging the open am infrastructure when troubleshooting.

      • handle

        public void handle​(RadiusRequest request,
                   RadiusResponse response,
                   RadiusRequestContext reqCtx)
            throws RadiusProcessingException
        Description copied from interface: AccessRequestHandler
        Determines how the passed-in request should be handled and calls the send method in the context passing the appropriate response packet of type AccessAccept, AccessReject, or AccessChallenge. Only one call to the context's send method is accepted. Any following calls will be ignored. Once this method returns, the context object is disabled so that any subsequent calls by a launched thread for example will be ignored. If this method returns without invoking the handler's send method then the request packet is essentially dropped silently.
        Specified by:
        handle in interface AccessRequestHandler
        Parameters:
        request - the access request
        response - - the response to be sent to the client.
        reqCtx - - provides methods that the handler can use to obtain information about the context in which the request was made, for example the name and IP address of the client from which the request was received.
        Throws:
        RadiusProcessingException - when a response to the request can not be sent.
